thread.title: Position yourself for a successful Work Truck Show by following new social media accounts
thread.title_full: Position yourself for a successful Work Truck Show by following new social media accounts - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Position yourself for a successful Work Truck Show by following new social media accounts
text:
NTEA
Attendees and exhibitors stay in touch year-round on Facebook and Twitter
FARMINGTON HILLS, Mich. , Aug. 19, NTEA – The Association for the Work Truck Industry, has launched two new social media destinations to help industry professionals better connect with The Work Truck Show ® 2016. Users can "like" a dedicated Work Truck Show Facebook page to see the latest Show news, photos and videos, while exhibitors can follow @WTS_exhibitors on Twitter to receive important updates as the event approaches.
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150819/259615
The Work Truck Show is North America's largest work truck event. Produced annually by NTEA, the 2016 Show will be held March 2–4 at the Indiana Convention Center in Indianapolis, Indiana . Educational programming, including the Green Truck Summit, begins March 1 .
"By following our new social media accounts, attendees and exhibitors will be better positioned to connect with each other and have a successful experience at The Work Truck Show 2016," says Steve Carey , NTEA executive director. "We'll interact with followers and post live updates from the trade show floor on The Work Truck Show Facebook page. On Twitter, the new @WTS_exhibitors account will be an invaluable resource for exhibitors as they prepare for the event. Using these tools, it will be easier than ever for work truck industry professionals to leverage the event to build their businesses and improve their operations."
While www.facebook.com/TheWorkTruckShow is dedicated to Work Truck Show content, general NTEA and industry news can still be found at www.facebook.com/NTEA.TheAssociationForTheWorkTruckIndustry . On Twitter, the new @WTS_exhibitors handle will complement NTEA's existing @WorkTruckShow and @NTEANews accounts.
The Work Truck Show 2016 conversation has begun on all of these channels. Join in with the event's official hashtag, #worktrucks16, and the official Green Truck Summit hashtag, #greentrucks16.
Each of these opportunities is also included in a new resource developed to make it easy for NTEA members and Work Truck Show exhibitors to participate in social media surrounding the Association and its events. The Social Media Toolkit is available as a free download at ntea.com/freedownloads .
The Work Truck Show features the newest vocational trucks, vans, vehicle components and equipment on a trade show floor covering more than 500,000 square feet. The event includes a robust educational conference with more than 60 sessions designed to help attendees improve efficiency, grow their operations and more. Visit ntea.com/upcomingevents and sign up to be notified when registration opens in October.
ABOUT THE NTEA
Established in 1964, NTEA , the Association for the Work Truck Industr y, represents more than 1,7 5 0 companies that manufacture, distribute, install, sell and repair commercial trucks, truck bodies, truck equipment, trailers and accessories. Buyers of work trucks and the major commercial truck chassis manufacturers also belong to the Association. NTEA provides in-depth technical information, education, and member programs and services, and produces The Work Truck Show . The Association maintains its administrative headquarters in suburban Detroit and government relations offices in Washington, DC , and Ottawa , O ntario , Canada .
